New Records: Golden State Warriors set a new record by winning in Boston for the first time since the New York Knicks on April 11; Golden State Warriors shot 14-of-34 from three-point range; Golden State Warriors became the first team to win in Boston in the regular season since April 11
Key Match Events: Golden State Warriors' 19-4 run in the fourth quarter; Boston Celtics trailed by as many as 14 points in the third quarter; Derrick White's three-pointer with 10:19 left gave Boston an 85-84 lead; Golden State Warriors stretched the margin to seven at 95-88; Buddy Hield's three-pointer with 47 seconds left sealed the win
Pre-Game Insights: Stephen Curry emphasized that the Warriors 'haven't done anything yet' despite their 7-1 start; Warriors focused on winning games they are supposed to win and protecting their home court
Post-Match Reflections: Stephen Curry expressed pride in the team's effort after the comeback win; Warriors' depth and strategy were highlighted as contributing factors to their success
Miscellaneous Highlights: Warriors' approach with multiple players and their strong performance after losing Klay Thompson; Steph Curry's season-high 27 points and nine assists; Buddy Hield's best heater of his career with a 50.7% three-point success rate
